instructions: Participants judged the probability of two different distributions of marbles among children.

items.question: On each round of a game, 20 marbles are distributed at random among five children: Alan, Ben, Carl, Dan, and Ed. Consider the following distributions: I (Alan: 4, Ben: 4, Carl: 5, Dan: 4, Ed: 3) vs II (Alan: 4, Ben: 4, Carl: 4, Dan: 4, Ed: 4). In many rounds of the game, will there be more results of type I or of type II?
